title: Take a deep breath
text: Breathe in for 4 seconds, hold for 4 seconds, and breathe out for 8 seconds. Repeat 10 times to help calm your mind.

title: Ask for help
text: It's OK to ask for help from those around you. Your friends and family will understand and would love to support you.

title: Send a message to a friend
text: Even just to say hello or send a cheeky emoji. We're sure they would love to hear from you.

title: Eat something heathy
text: Nuts, fruit, and dark chocolate are a great shout and proven to contain happiness boosting chemicals.

title: Look outside
text: Take a look at the view. Can you see buildings? Nature? Are there any birds in the sky? Try to notice your surroundings.

title: Drink some water
text: It's important to stay hydrated. Drinking a glass of cool, clear water will help to clear your head.

title: Look away from your screen
text: 3, 2, 1 (why are you still reading this!)

title: Respond to a friend's message
text: We've all got that message we've put off replying to. Now's the time! Even if it's just to say hello.

title: Wiggle your fingers and toes
text: Just a reminder that you still have them! Try to be mindful of your body and its needs.

title: Moisturise
text: Taking care of your body is just as important as taking care of your mind. It can make the world of difference.

title: Brush your hair
text: Taking care of your body is just as important as taking care of your mind. It can make the world of difference.

title: Watch some funny cat videos
text: Pop over to YouTube (we'll wait here) and search for "funny cat videos". Watch the first one that comes up.

title: Watch some cute puppy videos
text: Pop over to YouTube (we'll wait here) and search for "cute puppy videos". Watch the first one that comes up.

title: Open your curtains
text: If you haven't opened your curtains yet, get up and do it now. It's important have access to natural daylight.

title: Stretch out your arms
text: The higher the better. Have a good wriggle while you're at it to release any tension in your shoulders.

title: Adjust your posture
text: Shoulders back, chin up, back straight. We carry tension in our shoulders and upper back. Straightening up can help lighten the load.

title: Water your plants
text: Taking care of others (even a plant) helps take care of yourself. Make sure to remove any dead leaves while you're at it.

title: Play a song that makes you feel happy
text: When you listen to your favourite music your brain releases dopamine in anticipation of the peak moment of a song.

title: Close your eyes
text: Count to ten before you open them. Give them a little rest.

title: Write down your biggest worry
text: Write it down and then try to list out the evidence for and against it. I bet you'll find more evidence against.

title: Send a text
text: Text a friend and ask how they are. I bet they'd love to hear from you.

title: Picture a happy place
text: Is there a place you've felt safe or relaxed? Try to picture it in as much detail as possible. How did it make you feel?

title: Step away from your phone
text: Put me down.

title: Breathe
text: Breathe in for eight seconds, out for eight seconds. And repeat four times to help calm your mind.

title: Fill a glass with water
text: Drink it slowly, listening to your gulps. Feel the cool, clear water clearing your mind.

title: Having a negative thought?
text: Write it down and then try to list out the evidence for and against it. I bet you'll find more evidence against.

title: This too will pass
text: Remember that you're okay, you're safe, it's ok to feel what you're feeling, and this will pass, because it always does.

title: Get some time for you
text: Book a 30 minute slot for some me-time this week, time to have a bath, pop to a salon, or just curl up with a good book.

title: You are strong
text: You are a strong person who is dealing well with the challenges you face. Just keep doing your best.

title: You are wonderful
text: You are surrounded by people who love you and believe in you. Try to see the best in yourself, as others do.

title: You've got this!
text: You are awesome. You are amazing. You are as cool as a unicorn riding a rainbow. You've got this.

title: Believe in yourself
text: Have confidence in your abilities. You are talented and have skills that other people don't have.

title: Love yourself
text: Take care of yourself. Relax and find peace by breathing deeply and relaxing your shoulders.

title: Pay yourself a compliment
text: What is the best thing about yourself? Do you make a great cup of coffee? Are you a good listener? Write it down.

title: You are kind
text: You are kind hearted and generous. You are caring and thoughtful. Anyone would be lucky to have you as a friend.

title: Write down something you are grateful for
text: It can be as simple as the fact it didn't rain when you popped to the shops (or maybe it did rain, but not very heavily).

title: You are good at stuff
text: Write down three nice things about yourself. Do you have good taste in shoes? Are you good at your job? Write it down.

title: You are courageous
text: You are full of courage and inner strength. You face your demons and go on to fight another day. Go you.

title: Try to smile
text: It's scientifically proven that when you smile your body releases chemicals that make you feel happy.

title: Did you know
text: Some turtles can breathe through their butts under water. There, that's a thing you know now.

title: Have a treat
text: Have a slice of cake or a bar of chocolate. It's ok to treat yourself every now and again.

title: Eat some chocolate
text: Chocolate releases endorphins in the brain and contains anandamide, aka the bliss molecule. Science for the win!

title: Listen to your favourite tune
text: When you listen to your favourite music your brain releases dopamine in anticipation of the peak moment of a song.

title: Raise your hands in the air
text: The act of holding your arms above your head with clenched fists is scientifically proven to make you feel more powerful.

title: Did you know
text: The Roman Emperor Caligula tried to wage war on the god of the ocean, Neptune. He had his soldiers run up and stab the water.

title: Eat some fruit
text: A study conducted showed that healthy eaters who ate four servings of fruit and vegetables every day felt the best emotionally.

title: Eat a vegetable
text: A study conducted showed that healthy eaters who ate four servings of fruit and vegetables every day felt the best emotionally.

title: Look through your photos
text: According to researchers, flipping through personal photos can boost your mood more than drinking a glass of wine!

title: Did you know
text: Norway once knighted a penguin. (The penguin's full name is Colonel-in-Chief Sir Nils Olav).

title: Did you know
text: Every year, hundreds of new trees grow because of squirrels forgetting where they buried their nuts.

title: Do a buzzfeed quiz
text: Pop along to buzzfeed.com and find out what your favourite colour is by selecting your favourite food.

title: Choose a song from your chill-out playlist
text: Really listen. Let the music flow through you and relax every muscle in your body.

title: Read an article
text: Try and find something uplifting on boredpanda.com and remind yourself there is good in the world.

title: Get outdoors
text: Take a walk around the block or to your local park. Try to notice your surroundings and be mindful during the stroll.

title: Step away from technology
text: Put me down!

title: Have a shower
text: Warm your towel in the tumble dryer, pick your favourite body wash, get the temperature just right, and take a long shower.

title: Draw a picture
text: Get some paper and a pen and go doodle crazy. Draw anything you like, stickmen encouraged.

title: Grab a pen
text: Write down how you're feeling. Scribble it down. It's theraputic to get it down on paper and out of your head.

title: Make a herbal tea
text: Let the 'erbal goodness in and enjoy the calm.

title: Have you eaten recently?
text: Don't forget to keep your blood sugar up with nuts and fruit.

title: Grab a glass of water
text: Even mild dehydration may affect our moods and ability to concentrate.

title: Try some simple counting
text: Count backwards from 20 while you breathe to centre your thoughts and help you relax.

title: Grab a book
text: Pick up a new book from your favourite genre, or an old favourite, and lose yourself in a chapter.

title: Morning sunshine
text: Write a list of everything you're grateful for. Is the sun shining? Did you get a text from a friend?

title: Time for some peace of mind
text: Practice mindfulness. Need some help? Try the Headspace app

title: Bend and flex
text: Yoga is great for relaxing and calming your thoughts. Head over to doyogawithme.com and follow along to one of their videos.

title: Listen to some music
text: Put your headphones on, line up some tunes, close your eyes, and relax.

title: Have a dance
text: Put your headphones on, pick a song, and dance out your feelings for a few minutes.

title: Make a date
text: Schedule some time with someone who makes you feel good. Positive pals are infectious.

title: Go for a walk
text: Even if it's just around the block, it's always good to stretch your legs. Try to notice your surroundings as you go.

title: Find some nature
text: Do you have a local park or some trees at the end of your street? Head outside and spend some time in nature.

title: Find a podcast
text: Need some talking therapy? Or need a distraction? Choose a podcast to suit your mood and try to listen to the end without doing anything else.

title: Put your trainers on
text: Go for a walk, a jog, or even a run if you feel up to it. Moving and being outdoors is good for the soul.

title: You are stronger than you think
text: You are a strong person who is dealing well with the challenges you face. Just keep doing your best.

title: You are good enough
text: All you can do is your best. And if that means staying in bed today, then that's OK. You are good enough.

title: It's OK to just be sad sometimes
text: We can't help our feelings. It's OK to feel sad sometimes. Just remember all feelings pass eventually.

title: Have a stretch
text: Stretching is a great way to release tension from the body and help soothe any anxieties you may be feeling.

title: Breathe
text: Practice mindful breathing to create space between your thoughts, emotions, and reactions.

title: Some wise words
text: It all begins and ends in your mind. What you give power to, has power over you.
